result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Branden Ray Cappeart appeared by video, in custody. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail is in court room and is being heard.
Court reqests Atty to put deft on contact list. 
Court spks on correspondence sent from deft.
Court orders that document be sealed. 
Court inquires on how much bond can be posted. 
DA is being heard on bond recommendation.

08:37 AM Defendant Branden Ray Cappeart in court, in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branden Ray Cappeart appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Deft heard on why he did not appear.
DA heard on bond recommendation.
Deft heard.
Court heard and imposes $1000 cash bail with conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx, no contact with C.W. or A.S.
Deft to contact the Public Defender today.
Court schedules with parties.
